result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Everette Dale Sarnstrom

records.addlTxt:
1:20 PM Everette Dale Sarnstrom appears in Court,  Atty Derek W Sanders, DA Halle E. Hatch for the State of Wisconsin.  DA Hatch would like to set a plea and sentencing about 60 days out. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 1:23 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. Defendant pleas NG. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 1:17 pm.

1:05 AM Everette Dale Sarnstrom appears in Court,  Atty Derek W Sanders, DA Halle E. Hatch for the State of Wisconsin. Dep. Luke Schladweiler. S/T. DA Hatch questions Dep. Schladweiler, Court reflects identification of DE. Cross Atty Sanders. DA Hatch is asking the Court find probable cause and bind DE over .Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on October 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
filed by DA Halle Hatch. eif

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY
NO POSSESSION OF CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES WITHOUT A VALID PRESCRIPTION
NO CONTACT WITH WINONA WELLS

3:17 PM District Attorney Halle E. Hatch in Court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Derek Sanders appears via Zoom videoconferencing.  Defendant Everette Dale Sarnstrom appeared via Zoom videoconferencing from Pierce County Jail.  Defendant qualifies for PD.  Court advises Defendant of charges and possible penalties.  Further reading waived.  Court advises of constitutional rights.  State requests $10,000 signature bond w/conditions of absolute sobriety, no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No contact with Winona Wells.  No objection.  Court orders bond as requested and advises of additional conditions.  Court questions Defendant's address, phone and dob.  Non-military.  Court advises of right to speedy Preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives.  Adjourned at 3:25 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
